issue.title: plotting with segtools no longer works

content.raw:
@ericr86 Upon further investigation, ```set_writeconsole_regular``` and ```set_writeconsole_warnerror``` were introduced in rpy2 ```2.6.0``` with an alias to the old ```set_writeconsole```, but it appears this alias was [removed completely in ```2.8.0```](http://rpy2.readthedocs.io/en/version_2.8.x/changes.html).

From the description given in rpy2 ```2.6.0```,

```get/set_writeconsole is now replaced by get/set_writeconsole_regular (regular output) and get/set_writeconsole_warnerror (warning and error). In order to conserve backward compatibility an alias for get/set_writeconsole_regular called get/set_writeconsole is provided.```

Unfortunately, no matter which option we choose, it seems we will have to require either a maximum version or a minimum version of rpy2.
content.html:
@ericr86 Upon further investigation, set_writeconsole_regular and set_writeconsole_warnerror were introduced in rpy2 2.6.0 with an alias to the old set_writeconsole, but it appears this alias was removed completely in 2.8.0.

From the description given in rpy2 2.6.0,

get/set_writeconsole is now replaced by get/set_writeconsole_regular (regular output) and get/set_writeconsole_warnerror (warning and error). In order to conserve backward compatibility an alias for get/set_writeconsole_regular called get/set_writeconsole is provided.

Unfortunately, no matter which option we choose, it seems we will have to require either a maximum version or a minimum version of rpy2.
